name: MacCallum House Inn

reviews.text: Like many places on the west coast, this place is over priced, over rated, and just plain dirty. No one bothered to tell us when we reserved the room that there would be backhoes and dumpsters sitting in front of the hotel. Oh, and don't be surprised if you get relocated to "one of their other properties" with beautiful gas station views. Motel 6 has more to offer than this place, at least there you know what to expect. Make sure you get to the "complimentary" breakfast super early, otherwise they may be sold out of 1/2 the menu items. People who rave about this place don't know any better. Skip this place and skip Mendocino.

reviews.text: The inn is perfectly charming, very Victorian, except with the addition of bedroom TVs (under a modesty drape so as not to jar the atmosphere!) and wireless internet. Rooms (we looked at three in the main bulding) are very spacious. The hot water is hot! Your stay comes with breakfast in the dining room downstairs, whcih is fantastic (fresh OJ, delicious thick bacon) and would be quite expensive a la carte!

reviews.title: Do you allow smoking in your suites?
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I enjoyed our spontaneious trip to Mendocino and stay at the MacCallum House very much. The complamentary breakfast and Hill House suite, number 28,was great. The only complaint I have was that our room smelled of cigaretts. Not a fresh cigarette smell, but that of a room that allowed smoking inside. We were never were asked if we prefered smokong or non; we never thought of it as we are both non-smokers and were not asked if we had a preference. Our stay would have been even better if our room had not of smelled of stale cigarette smoke. We do want to come back, but stay in one of your cute cottages around the main house next time, non-smoking.

reviews.text: My wife, 8-year-old daughter, and I spent three nights at the MacCallum House and were very impressed with the level of service we received. We initially booked a room in the Carriage House. The room was not huge, but there was a king bed, a futon for our daughter, and a private patio with a hot tub. It was clean and well appointed. Our only problem with the room was that the high-speed internet access did not work. We tried everything we could think of to get online and couldn’t do it. By the morning after our first night, the phone no longer worked, either. We informed the staff of this problem and were told that someone would take care of it. An hour or two later, we were told that their staff could not fix the problem and that they’d have to bring someone in to take care of it. They then offered us a room in the “Luxury Suites” building (a short walk outside of town) for the remainder of our stay at no extra charge as compensation. The room we ended up in was much larger with a foldout bed for our daughter, a huge bathroom with a Jacuzzi tub and sauna, another private patio with hot tub, and a lovely common area with newspapers, dining room, computer, etc. We felt they really went beyond what most hotels are willing to do these days to insure that we’d be happy with our stay. Apart from handling the issues with the room, the staff were friendly and accommodating. Breakfast was served each morning in the main dining room (necessitating a much-needed walk into town) and it was quite good. My only gripe was that the portions were too big compared to what I like to eat in the morning. All of the food was delicious, though. We ate supper in the MacCallum House restaurant one evening and found that to be quite good as well. It was a bit pricey, but everything was very well-prepared and service was good. (If you like such things, be sure to try the ginger-rye cocktail – it was stellar.) I would have preferred a wine list that ranged outside of California, but what they have on it is pretty good and the prices were not out of line.
reviews.title: Great service at the MacCallum House

reviews.text: And the service did not stop with the end of our stay. We got home and realized that we had left two bottles of wine in the refrigerator of our room. I e-mailed their innkeeping director to ask if the bottles could be shipped to us and to offer to pay for shipping. After a couple of days, there was no response and I was beginning to think about calling them when a package containing the wine showed up at our door. Another indicator of their willingness to insure a good experience for us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hubby and I needed a few days away from the rat race and decided to visit Mendocino. After researching thru TripAdvisor, and checking out MacCallum's website - noting the "Slow Season" Sun-Thurs special - first night regular price, 2nd night 60% off - I reserved Cottage #10, the Carriage House for 2 nights. We were NOT disapointed - it was a beautiful drive up from the Bay Area (although as other reviewers have mentioned, both Hwys 20 and 128 can be a bit on the nauseatingly winding side...). The moment we entered the main house we were treated very well by the MacCallum staff (we have stayed at four and five star hotels and so we know good service!). Loved our room, and enjoyed the hot tub immensely, along with the 4 pm wine and beer hour, which I haven't seen mentioned in any reviews here - very relaxing, the bartender was terrific and of course very service-oriented as were all the folks there. Visiting with the other guests during that hour was relaxing and friendly. And the BREAKFAST was to die for - loved that bacon. The king-sized bed in our room was comfy, and the Franklin stove a nice romantic touch. We knew after the first night we wanted to stay at MacCallum House again so we have already booked three nights in September - next time we're going to stay in the "Bug's Ear" cottage across Hwy 1 - can't wait!

description: We are a classic Victorian boutique hotel located in the heart of Mendocino. Situated on 2 acres of beautifully landscaped grounds the MacCallum House has a full service fine dining restaurant, casual cafe, and bar on site. We offer wedding and group services as well. Our accommodations feature a number of standard amenities including concierge services, 24 hour desk help, and our rooms have many luxury touches such as Shikai bath products, gourmet in room coffee, robes, fireplaces, hot tubs, DVD players, Ipod docking stations, phones, and ocean views. We provide free wireless internet property wide so you can stay in touch with the rest of the world. As part of our collection of rooms we also have two vacation homes that are fully equipped and great for families. In addition our Suites property has beautifully remodeled rooms (2011) complete with ocean views, jetted tubs, gas fireplaces, and large plasma televisions. Come discover why the MacCallum House is the most comfortable place to stay in Mendocino.
